definition: to calculate (using bamboo tokens on a counting board)/to count beads/fig. to budget/to plan (an investment)
chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: In his heart a man plans his course, but the Lord determines his steps.
sentences.chinese: 人心籌算自己的道路，惟耶和華指引他的腳步。

sentences.english: 4May he give you the desire of your heart and make all your plans succeed.
sentences.chinese: 將你心所願的賜給你，成就你的一切籌算。

sentences.english: The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華的籌算永遠立定，他心中的思念萬代常存。

sentences.english: God will permit nothing to hinder what he plans to do.
sentences.chinese: 神絕不會容許受任何事物去攔阻祂的籌算。

sentences.english: I'm going to gather some materials about Picasso.
sentences.chinese: 我籌算彙集一些涉及畢加索的質料。

sentences.english: The government is planning to build a dam here.
sentences.chinese: 當局籌算在這搭建一座防洪壩。

sentences.english: I'm planning to climb Mount Denali in Blaska.
sentences.chinese: 我籌算去攀登阿拉斯加州的德納裏山。

sentences.english: Many are the plans in a man's heart, but it is the Lord 's purpose that prevails.
sentences.chinese: 人心多有計謀，惟有耶和華的籌算，才能立定。

sentences.english: We are going to render them economic assistance.
sentences.chinese: 我們籌算向他們供給經濟援助。

sentences.english: My son whelpless ishs to get married in June.
sentences.chinese: 我的兒子籌算六月份結婚。

sentences.english: I'm thinking of quitting my job.
sentences.chinese: 我籌算辭去現在的工作。

sentences.english: When I got home. I rushed into the house to tell my wife what I was going to do.
sentences.chinese: 抵家的時期，我衝進屋裏，念睹告老婆我的籌算。

sentences.english: I intend to play basketball thellos winter.
sentences.chinese: 我籌算在這個年假打籃球。

sentences.english: My uncle is to Japan next.
sentences.chinese: 我叔叔下週籌算去日本。

sentences.english: I'm hoping to get to your showroom.
sentences.chinese: 我籌算到你們的展示中心看看。

sentences.english: What are you doing next Friday?
sentences.chinese: 下禮拜五您們籌算幹甚麼？

definition: to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
